results.title: New beginnings
results.creator_credit: Stella Paraskakis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Migrating to a new country as a young girl can be an overwhelming experience. This story captures the memories of life in a new country by a young girl who migrated to Australia from Greece with her family.
results.description: Migrating to a new country as a young girl can be an overwhelming experience. This story captures the memories of life in a new country by a young girl who migrated to Australia from Greece with her family.
description_for_label: Migrating to a new country as a young girl can be an overwhelming experience. This story captures the memories of life in a new country by a young girl who migrated to Australia from Greece with her family.

results.title: Leaving Tropeoulhos
results.creator_credit: Anastasia Solomidis and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Anastasia and her husband lived in a village in Greece. One day a government official arrived to ask whether they would consider migrating to Australia. They talked about it and decided that they had better take up this opportunity to improve their lives and provide opportunities for their children.

results.title: A Journey to freedom
results.creator_credit: Helen Schloetzer and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Helen survived life in a German detention camp, her life was completely disrupted by the horror of war. Helen and her family were displaced persons when they migrated to Australia. Helen and her family found themselves transiting to Bonegilla, temporary accommodation for new migrants who had exchanged free or assisted passage to Australia.

results.title: From Graz to Glenroy
results.creator_credit: Elfrieda Senycia, Viv Mehes and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: This story explores the journey of migration from Austria to Australia for Elfrida and her husband. As they rebuild life in a new country they deal with triumps and disappointments including the humiliation of never having their qualifications recognised in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elfrieda Senycia, Viv Mehes and ACMI Digital Storytelling

results.title: Don't tell me I can't
results.creator_credit: Krystyna Popczyk and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: This is a daughter’s dedication to her mother. Krystina’s mother managed a vision and hearing impairment with great courage and a ‘don’t tell me I can’t’ attitude.
results.description: This is a daughter’s dedication to her mother. Krystina’s mother managed a vision and hearing impairment with great courage and a ‘don’t tell me I can’t’ attitude.

results.title: Sustainability
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
Althea Hunt describes her life as a farmer’s wife from leaving her beloved family in Queensland to joining her husband and running their independent cereal farm in the Millewa district of Victoria. She talks of the enormous changes - the hard work and dealing with the often unrelenting climate of drought and cyclones whilst also raising three young children and maintaining the family unit. For Althea however, it has been exciting and rewarding to see how far their farm has come over the 30 year journey since she left Queensland.

results.title: Days of Echuca
results.creator_credit: Barbara Day and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Barbara courageously and openly speaks of the hardships she has endured in her life and how she has managed to recover from the tragedies of her life because she draws support from her spirituality, her family and her community. This story was produced as part of a project called Voices from the Riverlands, in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation.

results.title: Gungarri woman
results.creator_credit: Linda Wordie and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Linda is a Gungarri woman, and she has breast cancer. With this diagnosis you see life differently, butterflies, the moon and big cups of tea that become part of life’s healing.
results.description: Linda is a Gungarri woman, and she has breast cancer. With this diagnosis you see life differently, butterflies, the moon and big cups of tea that become part of life’s healing.

results.title: Peaches are a lustful fruit
results.brief_description: In 1960, when Domenic was 10, his father left Italy for Australia to work in Cobram. A year later Domenic followed with his mother and sisters. ” I never went to school in Australia so my voyage from Italy was the end of my childhood” Domenic’s story represents that of the many migrant workers who have helped build Australian agriculture. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).
